creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
medium: Porcelaneous stoneware with iron oxide designs under celadon glaze
text: The elongated tapering body, short neck, and narrow mouth identify this vessel as a type of vase known as a “plum vase.” Informed by similar vases imported from China, this style of vase took its Korean name, maebyeong, from the transliteration of the Chinese name, meiping..
title: Maebyeong with peonies
